column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$3$Dr. gave me this bc it was cheaper than Adderall XR (which worked like a charm) but this isn't helping at all. In fact it is causing other issues....like I am super ill and snap with little control of myself. It doesn't just limit my talking... I don't want to talk at all.... and I don't want to hear anyone else talk either.... not even on tv. And I am suppose to take it 2 times a day....well the second time I can't even remember if I took it or not. And it doesn't help me focus.... instead I kind of zombie out and don't think at all... I just stare. It makes me ill and paranoid....I miss my adderall

column1: 4$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/30/2011 8:28:31 PM$Reviewer: DawnB
column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$5$My son is 10 years old and has been taking Ridalin since he was 6 years old along with 36mg of Concerta in the morning. His origial doseage was 5mg twice a day once at 4PM and again at 7PM however last year I spoke with our family DR and informed him that it seemed as though at times it made it to where he could not go to sleep he would lay there in bed and stare at the ceiling or mess around for 3-4 hours after going to bed so we decided to cut out the 7PM dosage. However
column3: he still has this problemm at times. I have also noticed that there are times that this medicine seems to help and then other times he still bounces off the wall so I have had mixed feelings about it. I am thinking it is time to re-evaluate him and maybe try something differant.

compared to adderall"
6$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$12/9/2010 3:45:40 PM$Reviewer: John
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$2$"My Presciption 40mgs/day (I only take 20-30 though)

column1: After taking this medication for a month now
column2: it has been very good for me so far. The first week being on this med I was skeptical
column3: and it didn't seem to be working very well
column4: but I decided to go a couple more weeks

column1: It seems like once I got to my 3rd week the Ritalin started working better
column2: I know people say it is a stimulant
column4: but I think people don't understand that although it works the first time it may not work right till your body gets used to it.

column1: Here are my pros and cons of it so far:
Pros:
-Better Focus
column2: yeah I still get distracted from time to time
column3: but It's WAY easier to focus and concentrate.

column1: -My Vision looks sharper
column2: almost like how a T.V. is when you turn up the contrast.

column1: -Better a video games... Hey I'm a college student this stuff is important too lol.
-Slightly more sociable
column2: a little less shy

column1: -I feel more like a ""Normal"" person
Cons:
-Slightly increased heart rate 72bpm to 80-90bpm
-I get irrated easier
-Occasional mild depression when it is wearing off
-Desire to take more
column2: it's scary (I DO NOT do this though)

column1: -Decreased Appetite
If you're on this med
column2: don't be too quick to judge
column3: give it a month and see if it starts working better."

column1: 9$Condition: Depression$3/8/2010 3:06:39 PM$Reviewer: Livinv'LifeNow
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Just hit the 1 month mark of this medicine and it has TOTALLY given my life back.  I was severely depressed and on cymbalta and Geodon. My husband felt he was slowly losing me and that I would commit suicide
column3: which is how I felt. I am living life now and can't stand to be in bed. I am just scared that it will stop being effective someday.  I take 2-10mg pills in the morning and keeps me going all day and the plus is that I have lost 10lbs this first month.I was ready to give up hope
column4: until I took my own life in my hands and asked the doctor for specific meds. to try. First one was ADDERALL which didn't work. Then I asked for Rittalin which he happily gave me.  Now I don't even have to see him as much.My advice is research your own health
column5: ask the doctors to keep prescribing different meds. until you get it right! Don't just accept it

column1: 18$Condition: Depression$11/17/2008 6:50:43 PM$Reviewer: Steve R R
column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$1$5$"AN OPTION for some:Methylphenidate is one of the pills the Docs put me on to help alertness during the day. NOTE: I do not have ADHA !. The alertness problem is probably caused by other meds along with a ""thing"" they call DEPRESSION. IMPORTANT: I WAS ON PROVIGIL FOR ABOUT A YEAR BEFORE MY INSURER PULLED IT.  Provigil maintained a steady
column4: alertness (not a high) all day for me and wore off in the evening. I had very little insomnia . AND PROVIGIL DID NOT PRODUCE ADDITIONAL ANXIETY in my case.  Methylphenidate is to much like coffee
column7: and it's hard to find correct doses for an acceptable result. Also
column8: my experience is that a TOLERENCE to Methylin occurs FAST. My Doctor warned me about this. A few times a month I radically lower the dose and go through some rotten withdrawal on purpose. Otherwise tolerence develops quickly over about 4-8 days and the methylphenidate's effectiveness
column9: in my case would require increasing dosages(very bad news). With PROVIGIL
column10: tolerance was negligible. If you are looking for that which helps alertness along with better concentration (how can one concentrate well when one is just about to fall asleep?)...if you can afford it
column11: try to ask your Doc to let you try Provigil.  For me and my health situation PROVIGIL was far far superior to  METHYLPHENIDATE (AKA RITALIN)
column12: and if I could afford it
column13: I would revert to Provigil and I am trying to find some $ to offset the cost differential.  My doctor agrees and actully apologized that I was going from that which worked very well
column14: to an inferior med solution (FOR MY PARTICULAR CASE).

column1: HEY OUT THERE ... May your health improve no matter what
column2: and may we all arrive at a point where we need no pills or any medicine to thrive.

column1: Steve R R "

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$2$3$I have Fibromyalgia and Chronic Fatigue. When I'm not feeling so bad sometimes I can get by with a nap during the day
column3: but my energy level is always low. When the Chronic Fatigue kicks in

column5: but at 5mg I don't think it is doing anything. Does anyone else have any additional experience as a patient with this drug for a similar condition?

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$4$This mediation is an amphetamine basically and it made me feel like I was on 1000 cups of coffee.. I didn't sleep for two days
column4: and I felt drugged the entire time. It forces your brain to use up its neurotransmitters and then when you stop you crash. It is so odd that everyone knows that meth amphetamine is bad for you but if your doc writes an Rx for a stimulant drug like this then it is okay?
